Chancery.definition: the court having equity jurisdiction in England and Wales and presided over by the Lord Chancellor of Great Britain NOTE
Chancery.origin: [Middle English chauncery , alteration of chancellerie chancellor's office]

1.definition: the court having equity jurisdiction in England and Wales and presided over by the Lord Chancellor of Great Britain
1.note: Formerly a separate court, the Chancery is now a division of the Supreme Court of Judicature in England.

sub_terms.b: the principles and practice of judicial equity [court of ] see alsocompare

2 a.note: There are chancery courts in Arkansas, Delaware, Mississippi, New Jersey, and Tennessee.
